cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds perform the ecological process of seed dispersal.
Ecosystems have and exhibit ecosystem functioning.
remarks: Relation created to capture that functioning is an attribute/process of ecosystems.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds perform the ecological process of seed dispersal.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Role: key role in seed dispersal

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or biotic component acts as an agent or participant in a specified ecological process.
args.justification: Both relations link birds to the ecological process of seed dispersal and describe birds as performing/participating in that process. Normalizing to a single predicate focused on process participation avoids redundant variants ('performs', 'performs_process') and captures that birds are agents in the ecological process.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an ecosystem possesses or exhibits overall ecosystem functioning as one of its core properties or processual attributes.
args.justification: This relation captures that ecosystem functioning is an attribute/processual property of ecosystems ('ecosystems have and exhibit ecosystem functioning'). A dedicated predicate emphasizing that functioning is something the ecosystem has/exhibits is more precise than the noisy source label.

Both relations describe biotic components (birds) acting in or carrying out ecological processes (seed dispersal). They belong to a class capturing participation/agency of organisms in ecological processes.

The relation links an ecosystem to its functioning, which is treated as a property-like processual attribute of the ecosystem. A relation class for ecosystem function / property best captures this family of links.
These relations express that birds act as agents performing or participating in an ecological process (seed dispersal), which fits the broad notion of agency/actor-to-process relations.

The relation captures that ecosystem functioning is something ecosystems have or exhibit, i.e., a property-like attribute, so it belongs under a broad PROPERTY group rather than agency or composition.
